# GitHub Quiz 3 - Intermediate to Advanced

â“ What is a GitHub Action workflow file extension? ğŸŸ¢

ğŸ“ .github/workflows/*.yml
âš™ï¸ .github/actions/*.yaml
ğŸ§± .github/workflows/*.json
ğŸ“¦ .github/actions/*.xml

ğŸ’¡ GitHub Actions workflows are defined in YAML files stored in the `.github/workflows/` directory with `.yml` or `.yaml` extensions.

---

â“ Which GitHub feature allows you to review code changes before merging? ğŸŸ¢

ğŸ“ Pull Request
âš™ï¸ Issue
ğŸ§± Discussion
ğŸ“¦ Wiki

ğŸ’¡ Pull Requests enable code review, discussion, and collaboration before changes are merged into the main branch.

---

â“ What does the `git push --force-with-lease` command do? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Safe force push with checks
âš™ï¸ Force push without checks
ğŸ§± Merge remote changes
ğŸ“¦ Create new branch

ğŸ’¡ `--force-with-lease` checks if the remote branch has been updated before force pushing, preventing accidental overwrites.

---

â“ Which GitHub feature tracks project progress and deadlines? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Projects (Beta)
âš™ï¸ Issues
ğŸ§± Discussions
ğŸ“¦ Wiki

ğŸ’¡ GitHub Projects provides kanban boards, tables, and roadmaps to track project progress and manage workflows.

---

â“ What is a GitHub Environment used for? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Deployment protection rules
âš™ï¸ Repository settings
ğŸ§± User preferences
ğŸ“¦ Organization policies

ğŸ’¡ Environments allow you to configure deployment protection rules, secrets, and approval workflows for specific deployment targets.

---

â“ Which command creates a new branch and switches to it? ğŸŸ¢

ğŸ“ git checkout -b branch-name
âš™ï¸ git branch branch-name
ğŸ§± git switch branch-name
ğŸ“¦ git create branch-name

ğŸ’¡ `git checkout -b` creates a new branch and immediately switches to it in one command.

---

â“ What does GitHub Dependabot do? ğŸŸ¢

ğŸ“ Automatically updates dependencies
âš™ï¸ Manages user accounts
ğŸ§± Controls repository access
ğŸ“¦ Monitors code quality

ğŸ’¡ Dependabot automatically creates pull requests to update your dependencies when new versions are available.

---

â“ Which GitHub feature allows team discussions outside of issues? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Discussions
âš™ï¸ Wiki
ğŸ§± Projects
ğŸ“¦ Actions

ğŸ’¡ Discussions provide a space for team conversations, Q&A, and announcements separate from issue tracking.

---

â“ What is the purpose of GitHub Codespaces? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Cloud development environment
âš™ï¸ Code hosting
ğŸ§± Issue tracking
ğŸ“¦ Documentation

ğŸ’¡ Codespaces provides a complete development environment in the cloud with pre-configured tools and dependencies.

---

â“ Which command shows the commit history in a graph format? ğŸŸ¢

ğŸ“ git log --graph --oneline
âš™ï¸ git show --graph
ğŸ§± git history --graph
ğŸ“¦ git graph --oneline

ğŸ’¡ `git log --graph --oneline` displays a visual representation of the commit history with branch and merge information.

---

â“ What does GitHub Advanced Security provide? ğŸ”´

ğŸ“ Code scanning and secret detection
âš™ï¸ Basic repository features
ğŸ§± User management
ğŸ“¦ Issue tracking

ğŸ’¡ Advanced Security includes code scanning, secret scanning, and dependency review for enterprise repositories.

---

â“ Which GitHub feature manages repository access and permissions? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Settings > Collaborators
âš™ï¸ Settings > Pages
ğŸ§± Settings > Actions
ğŸ“¦ Settings > Security

ğŸ’¡ Collaborators settings allow you to manage who can access and contribute to your repository.

---

â“ What is the purpose of GitHub Packages? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Package registry hosting
âš™ï¸ Code hosting
ğŸ§± Issue tracking
ğŸ“¦ Documentation

ğŸ’¡ GitHub Packages allows you to host and manage packages alongside your source code in the same repository.

---

â“ Which command shows the difference between working directory and staging area? ğŸŸ¢

ğŸ“ git diff
âš™ï¸ git diff --staged
ğŸ§± git diff HEAD
ğŸ“¦ git diff --cached

ğŸ’¡ `git diff` shows changes in your working directory that haven't been staged yet.

---

ğŸ“ Financial support for developers
âš™ï¸ Repository donations
ğŸ§± Organization funding
ğŸ“¦ Project crowdfunding

ğŸ’¡ GitHub Sponsors allows the community to financially support open source developers and projects.

â“ Which GitHub feature provides automated code review? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Code review automation
âš™ï¸ Issue automation
ğŸ§± Action automation
ğŸ“¦ Wiki automation

ğŸ’¡ Code review automation can assign reviewers, check for required reviews, and enforce review policies.

---

â“ What is the purpose of GitHub CLI? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Command-line GitHub access
âš™ï¸ Desktop application
ğŸ§± Web interface
ğŸ“¦ Mobile app

ğŸ’¡ GitHub CLI allows you to use GitHub from your terminal with commands for common operations.

---

â“ Which command shows the status of your working directory? ğŸŸ¢

ğŸ“ git status
âš™ï¸ git show
ğŸ§± git log
ğŸ“¦ git diff

ğŸ’¡ `git status` shows the current state of your working directory and staging area.

â“ What does GitHub Enterprise provide? ğŸ”´

ğŸ“ Self-hosted GitHub instance
âš™ï¸ Cloud hosting only
ğŸ§± Basic features only
ğŸ“¦ Limited access

ğŸ’¡ GitHub Enterprise allows organizations to host GitHub on their own infrastructure with additional security and compliance features.

â“ Which GitHub feature manages repository templates? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Repository templates
âš™ï¸ Issue templates
ğŸ§± Action templates
ğŸ“¦ Wiki templates

ğŸ’¡ Repository templates allow you to create new repositories with predefined structure, files, and settings.

ğŸ“ Repository analytics and metrics
âš™ï¸ User analytics
ğŸ§± Organization analytics
ğŸ“¦ Project analytics

ğŸ’¡ GitHub Insights provides data about repository activity, contributors, and community engagement.
